intro: Trachys muricata, commonly known as the roughleaf spurge, is a flowering plant native to parts of South America. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its hairy, ribbed stems and lobed leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are clustered in cyathia, typical of the spurge family. It thrives in dry, disturbed habitats and is often found in grasslands and rocky areas. Trachys muricata is sometimes cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its distinctive appearance.
